markdownRemark.html:
“Mendicants, you should give up desire … greed … desire and greed for what is not-self. And what is not-self?

Sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts are not-self …”

SN.35.189–191. Ajjhattātītādidukkhasutta (“The Interior as Suffering in the Three Times”)

frontmatter.excerpt: SN.35.183–185. Bāhirānattachandādisutta ("Desire, Etc. for the Not-Self Exterior")

prev.excerpt:
“Mendicants, you should give up desire … greed … desire and greed for what is suffering. 
And what is suffering?  Sights, sounds, smells…

frontmatter.title: Saṁyutta Nikāya ("The Linked Discourses")
frontmatter.excerpt: SN.35.180–182. Bāhiradukkhachandādisutta ("Desire, Etc. for the Suffering Exterior")
